entry.title: Binance’s Zhao Pushed to Shutter US Exchange Ahead of Lawsuits
entry.summary:
Binance's founder and CEO, Changpeng Zhao, has considered shuttering the US affiliate of the crypto exchange earlier this year to protect the broader global operations, according to a report by The Information. However, Zhao's decision was blocked by Brian Shroder, CEO of Binance.US.
CZ Tried to Shutter Binance.US
Though officially not confirmed, the board of directors of the US unit of Binance voted on the proposal to close the company. Though Zhao has no executive role in that US entity, he still sits on the board as the Chair. Binance refused to comment on the report.
Binance, the largest global crypto exchange in terms of trading volume, launched its US exchange in September 2019 after securing registration from the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). The purpose o…

entry.title: East Meets West: Hong Kong's Hex Trust Secures French Crypto License
entry.summary: While buzz grows around the Middle East and Hong Kong as emerging crypto hubs, do not overlook Europe. Specifically, France is making waves as a potential digital asset safe haven. Hex Trust just secured a license to offer digital asset custody and trading services. From Hong Kong to Europe: Hex Trust Gets a License in France The recent regulatory turmoil in the cryptocurrency industry has led many firms from the US and Europe to start relocating, among other places, to Hong Kong. This time, however, a firm from China's special administrative region decided to move to Europe, thereby expanding its previous scope of activity. Hex Trading, a digital asset custodian, has just obtained a license from France's Autorité des Marchés Financiers (AMF) and Autorité de Contrôle …

entry.title: Worldcoin cryptocurrency project suspended in Kenya
Voyager 30-Day Withdrawal Period Becomes Breeding Ground For Scammers – Report
entry.summary:
Fraudulent actors targeted Voyager Digital patrons as they briefly gained the opportunity to withdraw portions of their funds from the insolvent cryptocurrency brokerage. Bloomberg’s report, referencing insights from Darren Azman, the company’s legal representative, disclosed that scammers seized this month-long window.
The scammers employed diverse tactics in a range of stratagems detailed by Bloomberg. Among these, a prevalent approach involved luring Voyager customers with promises of elevated returns via counterfeit websites. Tragically, these sites siphoned the unsuspecting customers’ wallets once connected.
Azman further revealed that law enforcement agencies have been duly informed and are actively addressing the distressing situation.
Voyager Customers Withdraw Nearly Half…

entry.title: Kenyan Government Suspends Worldcoin Activity
entry.summary: Kenya is the first country to fully suspend Worldcoin operations. Data protection offices in Europe have started investigations.

entry.title: Binance Japan to Launch With 34 Listed Cryptocurrencies
entry.summary:
Binance, which is preparing to launch its new Japanese platform in August, will offer users the opportunity to trade 34 coins, local crypto media reported. Besides major cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin and ether, Binance’s own token will also be among the listed digital assets.
Binance to Restore Crypto Trading in Japan With More Coins Than Major Competitors
Binance Japan, a subsidiary of the world’s largest crypto exchange by daily trading volume, will launch with 34 listed tokens, according to the Japanese crypto news outlet Coinpost. On Aug. 1, the company shared details about the services it plans to provide later this month.
The initial offerings will include bitcoin (BTC), ether (ETH), and bitcoin cash (BCH), as well as XRP. Binance’s token Build and Build (BNB), formerly Bina…

entry.title: Crypto Custodian Hex Trust Expands European Foray With Registration in France
entry.summary: The registration, which follows last year's approval in Italy, is "a significant milestone" for its European expansion plans, Hex Trust said.

entry.title: Coinbase Looks to Add Bitcoin Lightning for Payments
entry.summary: The move is part of the exchange's broader plan to improve cryptocurrency-based payments globally.

entry.title: Binance's Largest Market is China: WSJ

entry.title: G20 President India Publishes its Input for Framing Global Crypto Rules
entry.summary: As the current president of the Group of Twenty (G20), India has made public its presidency note on crypto in an effort to have its suggestions included in the framing of global crypto rules.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Genesis Digital Assets Opens 3 New Data Centers in South Carolina
entry.summary:
Genesis Digital Assets (GDA), one of the world’s largest bitcoin mining companies, has opened three new data centers in the western region of South Carolina. The facilities represent GDA’s continued expansion in the United States, where its data centers now account for over 2% of Bitcoin’s total hashrate.
Genesis Digital Assets Reveals 3 New South Carolina-Based Mining Facilities
According to GDA, the first facility opened near Anderson in February and has a capacity of 18 megawatts (MW). Two more data centers launched in March between Union and Lockhart, adding 15 MW. By opening the sites, GDA disclosed it created about 150 local jobs and contracted 95% of the construction work to South Carolinians.
“I am extremely proud of the entire GDA team for opening these new facilities in onl…

entry.title: Buying $750 Million In Bitcoin? MicroStrategy Prepares For Stock Sale
entry.summary:
MicroStrategy Incorporated (NASDAQ: MSTR), one of the most prominent corporate Bitcoin holders globally, has announced plans to sell up to $750 million of its Class A common stock. The company signaled that the proceeds could potentially fund further BTC purchases.
The business intelligence firm filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on August 1, 2023, laying out its intent to sell shares of its Class A common stock, offering a prospectus supplement of up to $750 million. This move, in partnership with Cowen and Company, Canaccord Genuity, and Berenberg Capital, might signal another bold stride into the Bitcoin realm.
A Firm Bitcoin Strategy?
The software development firm has consistently articulated its commitment to Bitcoin, positioning itself as one of the cr…

entry.title: First Mover Asia: Asia Stocks Open Soft, Bitcoin Jumps Past $30K on MicroStrategy Filing and Despite Fitch Treasury Downgrade
entry.summary: PLUS: Bitcoin dominance sagged in July, absent a compelling BTC catalyst, and as altcoins seemed to benefit from a partial Ripple court victory.

entry.title: US District Judge Rejects Approach in SEC v Ripple Ruling on XRP
entry.summary:
A senior U.S. district judge has rejected the approach taken in the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) v. Ripple ruling regarding XRP. “The court declines to draw a distinction between these coins based on their manner of sale,” explained the district judge presiding over the SEC v. Terraform Labs case.
Judge Rakoff Rejects Approach in Ripple Case Over XRP
Judge Jed S. Rakoff, a senior district judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), has disagreed with the approach taken by District Judge Analisa Torres in the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) v. Ripple case concerning XRP.
Judge Rakoff’s disagreement arose as part of the case filed by the SEC against Terraform Labs and its co-founder Do Kwon. The securities regulator …

entry.title: Margot Robbie’s Barbie Film Takes A Bitcoin Twist With “Ken Energy” Quip
entry.summary:
Margot Robbie, the lead actress in the new Barbie movie, has sparked a conversation within the cryptocurrency community following her playful dismissal of Bitcoin (BTC) as a stereotypically “Ken” topic of discussion.
In a recent interview promoting the film produced by Mattel, Robbie jokingly referred to male producers frequently engaging in conversations about Bitcoin as “such Kens.
Bitcoin Buzz Into Barbie Film
Although Robbie has seldom shared her views on cryptocurrency publicly, Mattel, the parent company of Barbie, has displayed longstanding support for blockchain technology as an emerging revenue stream for its brands.
In recent years, the company has explored the utilization of blockchain for creating digital collectibles and other products.
The inclusion of a Bitcoin r…

entry.title: U.S. DOJ Has 'Extremely Thin' Basis for Jailing FTX's Bankman-Fried Ahead of Trial: Defense
entry.summary: Attorneys for Sam Bankman-Fried pushed back against the U.S. Department of Justice's motion to remand the FTX founder in a court filing Tuesday.

entry.title: Robert Kiyosaki Warns US Economy Not Strong, America Broke — Says He Still Prefers Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki says the U.S. economy is not strong and America is broke. Noting that the stock market is going up because President Joe Biden raised the debt ceiling, he emphasized that he still prefers gold, silver, and bitcoin.
Robert Kiyosaki’s Latest Economic Warnings
The author of Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki, is back with more warnings about the U.S. economy. Rich Dad Poor Dad is a 1997 book co-authored by Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It has been on the New York Times Best Seller List for over six years. More than 32 million copies of the book have been sold in over 51 languages across more than 109 countries.
Kiyosaki slammed the Wall Street Journal in a tweet on Sunday for claiming that the U.S. economy is strong. He explained that the stock ma…

entry.title: Mt. Gox Former CEO Breaks Silence, Delivers Important Message To Creditors
entry.summary:
The Mt. Gox scandal remains one of the most significant events in the history of cryptocurrency. In 2014, the exchange suffered a major hack, resulting in the theft of over 850,000 Bitcoin (BTC), worth approximately $450 million.
Since then, the hunt for the stolen Bitcoin has continued. In 2019, a group of creditors filed a civil rehabilitation petition to recover their lost funds. The trustee in charge of the Mt. Gox estate, Nobuaki Kobayashi, has been selling off the exchange’s remaining assets to repay the creditors.
Recently, Australian entrepreneur and self-proclaimed Bitcoin creator, Craig Wright, claimed ownership of the 1Feex address, which has been linked to the Mt. Gox hack. Wright’s claims have raised questions since the 1Feex address received a significant amount of Bitco…

entry.title: Binance Nearly Shuttered U.S. Exchange to Protect Global Operations: The Information
entry.summary: As investigations loomed, the board of directors of Binance.US voted on whether to liquidate the company but could not come to a unanimous decision, The Information reported.

entry.summary: From supercomputer simulations to a kitchen recreation, the news has riled up the science community.

entry.summary: Worldcoin has introduced a concept called “proof of personhood" to keep AI bots out of its global financial network.

entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: DeFi Contagion? Curve Finance Exploit Ripples Across Industry
entry.summary: Smart contracts built using older Vyper versions are vulnerable to hacks, according to the programming language’s developers.

entry.summary: Altogether Tether has about $72.5 billion worth of U.S. Treasury Bills backing its USDT stablecoin, according to the report.

entry.summary: Hex founder Richard Heart and three entities have been charged today for allegedly conducting unregistered crypto asset securities offerings.

entry.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says opponents shouldn't use Bitcoin's climate concerns as an excuse to block people's "freedom to transact."

entry.summary: The regulator reportedly wanted Coinbase to cease trading all cryptocurrencies except Bitcoin prior to its legal action against the exchange.

entry.title: DeFi Exchange Curve Finance Confirms Various Ethereum Pools Hacked
entry.summary: The Curve Finance team has confirmed which pools were affected in the latest multi-million dollar exploit due to a Vyper vulnerability.

entry.summary: The donor compared the proposal to the classic “Nigerian prince” email scam.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdić, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.
